Posted By: Firesplitter. (9/26/2012 3:35:27 AM)

posts.post_content:
Lorendorky, you have a point. I haven't seen a good Drake since... well,   
I mean, there's [Peregrine Drake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Peregrine Drake), and then there's [Gilded Drake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilded Drake). Do note, there are in Urza's Saga, the set where it had lots of cards that become more powerful as more cards are printed (e.g. [Tolarian Academy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tolarian Academy) wasn't as powerful when it was printed, because cards like the Artifact Lands and the non-power 9 moxen haven't been printed yet).  
  
However, I can't agree with your "unplayable in limited" statement. Flying creatures are a huge problem in this set's limited environment, and giving a flying creature flash is exceptionally dangerous, especially in one of Azorius' colours.   
There are 16 common and uncommon instant's that you could pull in ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) or ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol). One of the easiest and most necessary when drafting Azorius are [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel), [Synopate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Synopate), [Azorius Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azorius Charm), [Inspiration](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inspiration), autocar... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

However, I can't agree with your "unplayable in limited" statement. Flying creatures are a huge problem in this set's limited environment, and giving a flying creature flash is exceptionally dangerous, especially in one of Azorius' colours.

Posted By: Ferlord (1/5/2013 8:52:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Compare and contrast [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel). For four mana you can get a cheaper creature with a very useful ability and it is even part of a better tribe. All you need to do is spend more money or have some lucky pulls. This sort of thing is really bad for the game and turns it into a pay to win model.  
Interestingly, this card is not bad even in its current state. This can still ambush quite well and a 3/4 in the skies is a respectable threat. At six mana this card is just fine. You get 3/3's with flying and another ability all the time at five.
posts.html:

Interestingly, this card is not bad even in its current state. This can still ambush quite well and a 3/4 in the skies is a respectable threat. At six mana this card is just fine. You get 3/3's with flying and another ability all the time at five.
